alert.note: Alert for Kent; Providence (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 06 at 4:44AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban area and Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern Rhode Island, including the following counties, Kent and Providence. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 442 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 3 and 8 inches of rain have fallen over this area in the last 24 hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Providence, Warwick, Cranston, Pawtucket, East Providence, Woonsocket, Cumberland, North Providence, Johnston, North Attleborough, Attleboro, Smithfield, Lincoln, Central Falls, Burrillville, North Smithfield, Scituate, Glocester, Plainville and Foster. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night, when it is harder to see the dangers of flooding.
